org.xlattice.corexml.bind

Class Join

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.corexml.bind.Join
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Binding, Collector, Interface, SubMapping

    public abstract class Join
extends java.lang.Object
    Superclass of mappings between XML nodes and Java classes. These may be Bindings, which associate element and attribute values to object fields; SubMappings, which associate elements with Java class instances; or Collectors, which signal that a tag will appear in the XML with no correspondence to an object field value or instance.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

      • size

        protected int size(java.lang.Object o)
            throws CoreXmlException
        Return a count of the number of instances in the parent object that correspond to this Join. XXX MAY NOT RETURN A CORRECT VALUE IF minOccur == 0 and XXX maxOccur == 1
        Parameters:
        o - object in which instances are to be found
        Returns:
        the number of instances
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • findMethods

        protected void findMethods(java.lang.Class clazz)
                    throws CoreXmlException
        Find the setter, getter, and sizer methods in the class. This is called recursively by the Mapping.join() after Mapping definition is complete. If this method is called more than once, the results are unpredictable.
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • setClazz

        protected void setClazz(java.lang.Class clazz)
        Called by subclasses after integrity checks, finding getter/ setter/sizer methods, and anything else related to a join() call. The join() call is made as the last step in setting up a Mapping. There must be only one join() call and so only one Join.setClazz() call.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class involved in the binding

      • joined

        protected boolean joined()
        Whether the recursive Mapping.join() call has been made. Once this is set, no further changes to the Mapping definition may be made.
        Returns:
        whether XML/object binding has been set up

      • checkJoinObject

        protected void checkJoinObject(java.lang.Object o)
        Check whether the Join has been set up and if so whether the object is an instance of the bound class. XXX If Join is an Interface, object may belong to any of several classes. So we need a boolean matchClass(Object o)
        Parameters:
        o - object whose class is inspected

      • checkElmJoin

        protected Element checkElmJoin(Node node,
                   java.lang.Object o)
        Check whether the target Node is an Element after checking whether the Join has been set up and the object is an instance of the appropriate class.

      • checkNameAndState

        protected void checkNameAndState(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String what)
        Confirm that the name being assigned is neither null nor empty and that there has been no join() call.

      • join

        protected abstract void join(java.lang.Class clazz)
                      throws CoreXmlException
        Set the clazz for this Join and any descendents. Subclasses should call setClazz() to set the clazz here, in the parent.
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class involved in the Join
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • joinType

        protected abstract int joinType()
        Returns:
        the type index for a Join

      • apply

        protected abstract void apply(Node node,
         java.lang.Object o)
                       throws CoreXmlException
        Apply a Join, binding an XML value to a field in the object.
        Parameters:
        node - an XML element or attribute
        o - an instance of the class being bound to
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • generate

        protected abstract void generate(Node parent,
            java.lang.Object o)
                          throws CoreXmlException
        Apply a Join in the opposite direction, generating an XML element or attribute whose value depends upon the value of the bound field in the object.
        Parameters:
        parent - Element to which an attribute/value pair or or subelement is being added
        o - the object whose field is used to determine the value set
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException
